programme.desc: It’s estimated that roughly 10,000 people are wrongfully convicted in the U.S. each and every year for crimes they didn’t commit. Out host’s goal is to calm those fears by inviting the audience along with her as she strives to learn how to take action against the problems plaguing our planet. programme.title: The Civic Rally Ripper Gets Safety & Seat Upgrades
programme.desc: Our '96 Honda Civic Rally car gets some racing seats for comfort and a rally cage for added safety.

programme.title: Adding More Power to the Rally Car’s 4 Cylinder
programme.desc: We do a little wrenching on our Honda 4 cylinder. Updating some key components and sealing up some oil leaks. Plus, the Civic gets a facelift with a Rally Car inspired paint job.

programme.title: AMC Prep and Paint
programme.desc: Our AMC Javelin gets a freshen-up in the paint department with some help from an old friend. We show you some simple and easy ways to make your paint look amazing.

programme.title: AMC Javelin Horsepower
programme.desc: We put some muscle behind our 1973 AMC Javelin, and we see how far it will go on the Dyno.

programme.title: Day of Redemption
programme.desc: We take our hefty hearse down the eighth mile with a little help from some throttle in the bottle ... Plus, some old school tech that may hit home.

programme.title: Building A Bronco
programme.desc: With the help of some master craftsmen, the guys start building a Bronco from the ground up, one that will cruise the beach, scream down the interstate, and everything in between.

programme.title: The Unbreakable Suburban is Going Off Road
programme.desc: The guys put Project Unbreakable, our ’91 Chevy Suburban, to the test at Adventure Off Road Park! From trails to mud we’ll see it all! Plus, we’re off to a viewer’s house to rescue the interior of her 1966 Chevy C10.

programme.title: Jeep Wagoneer Transformed: “TrashHawk” Hits The Track
programme.desc: After completing final work on our TrackHawk inspired 1986 Jeep Wagoneer we call TrashHawk, it’s time for some high performance fun at the National Corvette Museum Motorsports Park track.

programme.title: First Gen Bronco Gets a Modern Suspension
programme.desc: Our ’74 Bronco build is getting a suspension overhaul plus new axles, brakes, wheels and tires! And John Kramen from Mecum Auctions stops by to check on the progress.

programme.title: Installing Sick Sounding Side Pipes
programme.desc: Javelin gets a new sick sound with a set of side pipes, before hitting the road for a little fun.

programme.title: A 50 Year Old Mustang Needs New Suspension Magic
programme.desc: The EBC Fastback Mustang has to hook and stick to the ground, so it’s time for some new suspension magic!

programme.title: Putting the Fast in Fastback/Coyote Transformation
programme.desc: The EBC Fastback Mustang is transformed from an iconic fastback to a muscle packed stallion.

programme.title: TIG Exhaust Tech and Mustang Interior Makeover
programme.desc: The Detroit Muscle crew creates a custom exhaust with some TIG Tech, and they lay out a new living room for our EBC Supercharged Coyote Mustang.

programme.title: What Muscle Car is Right For You
programme.desc: We look at several projects like Hard Charger – our 1969 Dodge Hellcat Charger, Sydewinder – our 1981 Fox Body Mustang Cobra, our 1966 Pontiac Convertible, and our 2016 Ford Mustang GT. We’ll give you a play by play of what it takes to build each one to help you decide what avenue to take for your vehicle.

programme.title: '69 Charger Hellcat Hits the Street
programme.desc: We take Hard Charger to the Mopar Nationals in Ohio to give it a final shakedown, then we try to decide our next project vehicle.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Tom Foss - Walking Shoes
programme.desc: Tom Foss has traveled around the world entertaining our troops. Including 5 tours to Iraq, 6 tours of Afghanistan, 11 tours of the middle east, 4 tours of Europe, 3 tours of the Far East, Greenland, 5 aircraft carriers, support ships and bases all around the United States. While not on tour overseas Foss keeps his foot on the ground as a regular at the Improvs, Funnybones and the world famous Hollywood Comedy Store.

programme.title: Jeff Big Daddy Wayne - Big Daddy Kicks It
programme.desc: Comedian Jeff Wayne was dubbed “Big Daddy” by Billy Crystal and Robin Williams on an HBO Comic Relief show. The moniker has stuck to a guy who’s been part of the stand-up comedy scene for a long time. He’s toured all over the world, several times in Europe. The Norwegian Newspaper “Sondags B.A.”, described him as having “amazing audience communication, and ferociously funny!”

programme.title: Bone Hampton - It Is What It Is
programme.desc: As down home as collards and cornbread, as sharp as a pickaxe, and as funny as a possum in a petticoat, Comedian Bone Hampton is a master at making audiences feel like family. His clean, homespun humor, sharp wit, and easy delivery makes the Dove Award-winning "Comedian of the Year" one of the most highly sought after performers in the business. With more than 20 years in the game, his résumé is ever expanding with impressive stage and TV credits. The Texas native has logged countless appearances on ABC's "The View," including two stints as Guest Co-Host, and has served as personal gag writer for Actress/Comedienne Sherri Shepherd since 2010. He's also appeared on ABC's "Less Than Perfect," NBC's "My Name is Earl," BET's "Comic View," and the syndicated talk show Comics Unleashed with host Byron Allen. And yes, that is Bone in the very funny national commercial for Church's Chicken. No stranger to the big screen, Bone has appeared alongside Hollywood juggernaut Sandra Bullock in the romantic comedy "All About Steve," and can be seen in the film "Woodlawn" starring Sean Austin and Oscar winner Jon Voight. Bone took a leap of faith and moved to Los Angeles to pursue comedy full-time. Nothing could have prepared him for the culture shock that greeted him. Next to the hardcore acts he shared the stage with, his family-friendly routine seemed soft. But that fish-out-of-water experience inspired him to remain true to himself and to his God—no matter where he performed. He set out to carve out a niche all his own. (And carve he did!) In 2005, the Urban Gospel Alliance named him “Comedian of the Year.” His mission was simple—“I just like to have a good time. I just want to be the ringleader of the good time,” Bone says. Ask anyone who’s ever seen Bone Hampton perform, they will tell you: Mission accomplished. Bone can be heard all day long on satellite radio, and caught on TV anytime your television is on.

programme.title: Mike Siegel - Have Jokes, Will Travel
programme.desc: Mike Siegel is a stand-up comedian, TV host, and actor. For nine years, he hosted TBS network’s TBS Movie EXTRA and has hosted numerous other network shows including HGTV’s If Walls Could Talk and What You Get For the Money, GSN Live on the Game Show Network, and The Next GAC Star on GAC. Along with numerous appearances as a panelist on E! network’s hit show Chelsea Lately, Mike has performed stand-up comedy on many television shows, including Last Comic Standing (NBC), The Late Late Show (CBS), Late Friday (NBC), Comedy Showcase with Louie Anderson (NBC), Stand-up, Stand-up (Comedy Central), and Friday Night (NBC). Mike’s also been seen on the small screen as an actor. He was a recurring guest star on the CBS drama JAG, and had supporting roles in Mike and Molly (CBS), Rules of Engagement (ABC), 24 (FOX), Prison Break (FOX), Better Off Ted (ABC), Less Than Perfect (ABC), Eve (UPN), Strong Medicine (Lifetime), Andy Richter Controls the Universe (FOX), and Sabrina (WB).

programme.title: Key Lewis - Half Black, Half White, Looks Mexican
programme.desc: Sacramento California born Key Lewis is a high energy, improvisational, storytelling, multiple-personality nutcase! His love for the people and hunger for the stage is his undying motivation. His comedic stories about his interracial childhood, family, and unusual views on relationships, make Key simply a joy to watch. His ability to improvise and interact with all types of crowds makes this up and coming comic and actor one to look out for. Key Lewis has appeared on Marlon Wayans TBSís Funniest Wins, Starz Networks StaannDup, Kevin Harts One Mic Stand as well as Bill Bellamyís Whoís Got Jokes! Key says, chase your dream, always know your audience donít act funny, be funny... donít worry about the quantity of your material but the quality the sooner you create a relationship with your crowd, the better you will be. Television: Bill Bellamyís Whoís Got Jokes on TVONE. BETíS One Mic Stand Hosted by Kevin Hart. Starz Network Comedy Series called StaannDup, Marlon Wayanís TBSís Funniest Wins! Competitions: Winner of the 2013 Rocky Mountain Laugh Off, Finalist in the 2010 Bay Area Black Comedy Competition, Semi-Finalist 2009 San Francisco International Comedy Competition, a Semi-Finalist in the 2008 Boston Comedy Festival, 2007 Seattle International Comedy Competition Finalist, Shades of Laughs Portland Oregon Winner, TVONE Bill Bellamyís Who Got Jokeís Contestant. Radio: Improv work with FM Morning Shows (Top 40 Radio): KSFM 102.5 (Sacramento, CA), KWOD 106.5 (Sacramento, CA) KWIN 97.7 ñ Stockton/Lodi, CA, Mix 107.9 Salt Lake City UT (Is It Racist Segment) & The Man Panel. Concerts/Festivals: Opened for Jon B. and Keysha Cole, Taste Of Tacoma, & Bite Of Seattle Fountain Stage 5 Years Running! Key Lewis has worked with the likes of Kevin Hart, Pablo Francisco, Sam Bam, Alonzo Bodden, Jay London, Gabriel Iglesias, Brooks McBeth, Tommy Davidson, Katt Williams, De-Ray Davis, Andrew Norelli, Lonnie Love, Jeff Garcia, Damon Wayans, Joey Diaz, Guy Torry, Darren Carter, Paul Mooney, Kermet Apio and many more.

programme.title: We Used to Eat Animals the Right Way - Here's What Changed
programme.desc: Dr. Bill Schindler explains why the processes we have in place today in the food industry lead to a less healthy and enriched lifestyle. The way humans eat animals has shifted. Our brains grew significantly once the human race started hunting its food. Diets that consisted of blood, guts, and organs contributed to that growth. These parts of animals are almost completely absent from modern day diets and these provided much more nutrition than just the animal's meat.
